info.name: NEW 2Do-styling for Toodledo
info.description: So I had another style for Toodledo that I had made based on the old 2Do interface. 2Do is an iOS, Android, and Mac OS app that syncs with Toodledo. It used to have a skeuomorphic interface based on natural elements like wood, leather, and cloth. Now it's gone all minimal just like everything in the Mac world. Sigh. But anyway, just so that I can get my Toodledo experience feeling a bit consistent, I've created a new style that uses some of the schemes of the new 2Do. Note that you might have to download and install a font on your computer for this to work fully. See the Additional Info section below.
info.additionalInfo:
You might need to download and install the Roboto font for this to work properly, at least on Firefox. On Chrome, this seems to work OK, but I can't get to get it to work on Firefox without installing the font locally. (If you know how to get around this, please let me know!) You can download the font from  http://www.google.com/fonts#UsePlace:use/Collection:Roboto

v01.3.2: Changed background color of mobile version to same periwinkle-ish colour
v01.3.1: Fixed appearance of links in notes in mobile view
v01.3: Fixed appearance of the header to account for new Toodledo.com layout
v01.2.1: Made "offline" warning for mobile version more conspicuous
v01.2: Added support for slim and mobile versions
v01.1: Small tweaks to font colors all over
v01.0: First version
